div.p: WHere the ale brewers and beere brewers of this realme of Englande haue vſed and dayely doo vſe for their owne ſingular lucre profite and gayne to make in their owne houſes theyr barrels, kylderkyns and firkyns of muche laſſe quantitie contente rate and aſſiſe than they ought to be, to the greate hurt preiudice and damage of the kynges liege people, & contrary to diuers actes ſtatutes ancient lawes & cuſtomes heretofore made had and vſed, and to the deſtruction of the poore craft or myſterie of coupers. For reformation wherof, be it enacted by the kyng out ſoueraigne lorde, the lordes ſpirituall and temporall, and the commons in this preſent parliament aſſembled, and by auctoritie of the ſame, that no bere brewer, nor ale brewer, that ſhall brewe to ſale bere or ale, ſhall from henſforth occupy by hym ſelfe, nor by any other to his vſe in his houſe nor els where, the myſterie or crafte of coupers, nor make any barrelles, kylderkyns, fyrkyns, or other veſſelles by hym ſelfe, nor by his or their owne ſeruantes, wherby they ſhall putte their beere or ale to ſale, but that all ſuche barrelles, kylderkyns, and other veſſelles of woode, wherwith they ſhall put their bere or ale to ſale, ſhall from henſeforth be made & marked accordyng as hereafter ſhalbe expreſſed, by the cōmon artificers of coupers exerciſed & practiſed in the ſaid occupation vpon peyne to forfaite and pay for euery ſuche barrell, kiſderkin, firkin, or other veſſell, hereafter to be made contrary to the tenor of this act. iii. s. iiii. d.

¶ And be it alſo enacted, that euery artificer of the craft or miſterie of coupers, that wyl exerciſe or practiſe to make any of the ſayd veſſels for bere or ale to be put to ſale, ſhal make the ſame veſſels, & euery of them, of good and ſeaſonable wodde, and put his propre marke vpon euery of them. And that euery barrell for bere ſhall conteyne. xxxvi. galons, euery kylderkyn for bere. xviii. galons, and euery fyrkyn for bere nine galons of the kynges ſtanderde gallon. And that euery barrell for ale ſhall conteyn. xxxii. gallons, euery kylderkyn for ale. xvi. galons, and euery fyrkyn for ale. viii. galons of the kynges ſtanderde gallon. So that they ſhall bee of good and iuſte meaſure, or elles aboue and not vnder. And that no couper ſhall make any other veſſell for bere or ale to be ſolde within this realme of any greatter or laſſer nomber of galons than is aboueſayde, oneleſſe he ſhall cauſe to be marked vpon euery ſuche veſſell, that he ſhall ſo make of greater or leſſer numbre of gallons, the trewe and certayne nombre of as many gallons, as euery ſuche other veſſell ſhall conteyne, to thentent that euery perſone may knowe the content thereof.

¶ And that no ſuche artificer of coupers ſhall enhaunce the prices of any ſuche barrels, kilderkins firkins, or other veſſels in the ſale of them to any ale brewer or bere brewer, or other perſone, but kepe the rates of ſuche prices as hereafter enſueth, and not aboue, vpon peyne to forfaite for euery barrell kilderkyn and firkyn defectiue or enhaunced in price in any poynt contrary to thys act. iii. s. iiii. d. That is to ſay, for euerye beere barrell. ix. d. For euery bere kylderkyn. v. d. and for euery beere firkyn. iii. d. And the ale barrell. xvi. d. the ale kylderkyn. ix. d. and the ale fyrkin. v. d.

¶ Alſo be it further enacted by the ſaid auctoritie, that no bere brewer nor ale brewer at any time after the feaſt of Lammas now next commyng, ſhall put theyr bere or ale to ſale to any perſon or perſons to be ſpent and occupied within this realme in any other barrels, kylderkyns, firkyns, or other veſſels of wodde, other than ſhall be made and marked by an artificer of coupers aboueſaide, whereof euery barrell for beere ſhall conteyne and holde. xxxvi. galons euery halfe barrell or kylderkyn. xviii. gallons, and euery fyrkyn. ix. galons. And euery barrell for ale ſhall conteyne. xxxii. gallons, euery kylderkyn. xvi. gallons, and euery fyrkyn. viii. galons of full and iuſt meaſure, or aboue, and not vnder that meaſure.

¶ And that any bere brewer or ale brewer ſhall not take ouer and aboue for any ſuche barrell, kylderkin,
or fyrkin of ale and bere, but after ſuche prices and rates, as ſhall bee thought conuenient and ſufficient by the diſcretions of the Iuſtices of peace within euery ſhire, where ſuch bere brewer and ale brewer ſhal dwel without any citie borowe or towne corporate, where no head officers, as Maires, bayliffes, ſhireffes, and other head officers, haue none auctoritie nor rule, and in euerye citie borough and towne, where there be Mayres Sheryffes, or other head officers, the ſame rates and prices to be named and ſeſſed by them & euery of them by their diſcretions. And that the ſayd ale brewers or bere brewers at any tyme hereafter ſhall not ſell their bere nor ale at any higher rates or prices than ſhall be to them aſſigned, after the forme aboue reherſed, vpon payne to loſe and forfaite for euery barrell ſo put to ſale contrary to this eſtatute. vi. s. for euery halfe barrell or kylderkyn. iii. s. iiii. d. and for euery fyrkin. ii. s. and for euery veſſell conteinynge greatter nomber of galons. x. s. and for euery other veſſell conteynyng leſſer nombre of galons. xii. d. The one halfe of all the whiche penalties and forfaitures to be to the kyng our ſoueraigne lorde, and the other half to him that wyll ſue for the ſame by action of debte, byll, playnt or information in any of the kynges courtes: In which actiō & ſuit the defendāt ſhal not wage his law, nor any eſſoin protection or priuilege to be admitted.

¶ Be it alſo further enacted by the ſaid auctoritie, that al maner of ſope makers within this realme of England, which ſhall put to ſale any ſope by barrell, half barrell, firkyn, or other veſſel, ſhal from Lammas now next cōming, make or cauſe to be made their barrels, halfe barrels, firkins, & other veſſels, accordyng to the rates contentes weightes and aſſiſes of old tyme vſed and accuſtomed, that is to ſay, euery empty barrell to holde and conteyn. xxxii. galons or aboue, and to be in weyght. xxvi. poundes, and not aboue, of full and iuſt meaſure, and euery halfe barrell emptie to be in weight. xiii. li. and not aboue, and to hold and conteyne. xvi. galons or aboue: and euery firkyn emptie to weye. vi. poundes and an halfe, and not aboue, and to holde and conteyne. viii. galons or aboue, vpon payne of forfayture for euery ſuche barrell halfe barrell fyrkyn or other veſſell hereafter to be made had or vſed contrary to this act. iii. s.. iii. d.

¶ And alſo be it enacted by the auctoritie aforſaid, yt the wardēs of thoccupatiō or miſterie of coupers with in the citie of London frō hensforth at al tymes hereafter when they ſhal thinke conuenient & expedient, takyng with them an officer of the Mayres, ſhal haue full power and auctoritie by vertue of this act, to ſerch view and gage all maaer of ſuche barrels kilderkins, firkins, and other veſſels to bee made or occupied for ale beere or ſope to be put to ſale within the citie of London, and ſuburbes of the ſame, & within two myles compas without the ſame ſuburbes, to view and ſe that the ſame barrels kilderkins firkins & other veſſels aſwell within liberties as without, be made & marked well & ſufficiently, and beare & cōtein their true contents rates & meſures, according to theffect of this eſtatute: And alſo to marke euery ſuch barrell kilderkyn firkin & other veſſel by them ſo viewed & gaged, bearing and cōteining their true cōtentes, with the ſigne & token of a ſeint Antonies croſſe. The ſame wardens to haue for the ſerche & gaging of euery ſuche barrell, kilderkin firkin & other veſſell by them ſo ſerched viewed gaged & marked one farthing, & not aboue, of the owners or makers of the ſaid veſſels. And ſhall & may haue auctoritie by vertue of this act to reteyne euery ſuche veſſell as they ſhall ſo gage ſerche and marke, vnto ſuche tyme as they ſhalbe ſatiſfied thereof. And in caſe they ſhall fynd any of the ſayde veſſels defectiue, not bearyng their true contentes, that than by aucthoritie of this act, they may ſeaſe take and reteyne euery ſuch veſſell, and cauſe the ſame to bee marked or amended, accordying to the true content, or els cauſe the ſame to be brenned. And alſo the partye owner of ſuche veſſell to loſe and forfayte for euery ſuche veſſell not beynge of the full contentes after the rate aboue expreſſed. xii. d. to be recouered and employde as is aboue ſayde.

¶ And be it further enacted by the ſayd auctoritie, that in al other cities, borowes, and townes, wherin no
ſuche wardens of coupers be, that the Mayres, Sheryffes Ba ••• ſtes, Conſtables or other head office • s in ſuch Cities, borowes and townes ſhall haue power and auctoritie to ſerche, viewe, and gauge all ſuch barrells, kylderkyns, fyrkyns, and other veſſels to be made hereafter anye ſuch citie borowe or town, and to haue and take all ſuch auantage therby and in lyke maner and fourme as the wardens of coupers within the citie of London or other perſons by this act ſhuld or may haue or take on euery behalfe.

¶ Prouyded always yt euery bere brewer may kepe in his houſe one or two ſeruātes of the miſterie or crait of coupers to houpe and amend his barels, kylderkyns, fyrkyns, & other veſſels, wherin they ſhall put their bere to ſale frō time to time, this act or any thing therin cōteined to ye cōtrary in any wiſe notwithſtāding.

〈…〉 it further enacted by the ſayd auctoritie, that if any perſon at any time after the ſaid feaſt of Lam 〈…〉 commyng, do mynyſhe or cauſe to be myniſhed any maner of barrell, kylderkyn, or fyrkyn to the ••• eyte of any the kynges ſubiectes by reaſon of takynge out the head of any ſuch veſſell, or takynge oute of any ſtaffe out or from any ſuch veſſell, that then euery ſuch veſſell to be brent, and thoffender to forfayte for euery ſuch offence. iii. s. iiii. d. the one moytie therof to be to the kynge our Soueraygne Lorde, and thother moytie therof to hym or them of the kynges ſubiectes that wyll ſue for the ſame, to be recouered in maner & fourme aboue reherſed. And the partie ſo offendynge to be further puniſſhed by the diſcretion of the head officer or officers, before whom ſuch default ſhalbe preſented.

¶ It is enacted by aucthoritie of thys preſent parlyament, that notwithſtanding any thing conteyned in thys acte of brewers and coupers, whervnto this Cedule is annexed, it ſhalbe leful to euery alebrewer mentioned in the ſame acte to haue and retayne in his ſeruice one perſon of the miſterie or crafte of coupers, to exerciſe in his ſeruice the crafte of a couper, only in byndyng, houpyng & pinning his maiſters ale veſſells, recited by the ſayd acte, and in none otherwiſe to vſe or exerciſe any making of veſſels concerning the craft or miſterie of a couper, whiles that he is in the ſeruice of any ale brewer. Alſo it is enacted, that euery couper, which hereafter ſhall make any ale veſſel ſpecyfied in the ſayde acte, ſhall from the feaſt of Penthecoſte next cōming make euery ſuch veſſell accordyng to the aſſiſe ſpecifyed in the treatiſe called Compoſitio menſurarum, that is to ſay euery barrell for ale ſhall conteine. xxxii. galons of the ſaid aſſiſe or aboue, of the whiche. viii. galons make the commō buſſhell to be vſed in this realme of England euery kylderkyn for ale. xvi. galons of the ſayd aſſiſe or aboue, and euery fyrkin. viii. galons of aſſiſe or aboue, vpon payne of forfayture of iii. s. iiii. d. for euery of the ſame veſſels by hym vntruely made contrary to this acte: the one halfe of the ſame forfayture to be to the kynge, and thother to hym that will ſue for the ſame, by action of dette, byl, playnte, wrytte or otherwiſe: In which action none eſſoin, protection or wager of lawe ſhalbe allowed.

¶ And be it alſo enacted, that euery couper marke his veſſell with his own marke, vpon payne of. iii. s. iiii. d to be leuied and recouered after like maner and forme as is aboue ſayd. And that no maner of perſon in the ſerche makyng for the true gaugyng of any ſuch veſſells, ſhal put out the ale of any ſuch veſſell. wherby the ſame ale ſhalbe ye worſe. And that it ſhalbe laweful to euery ale brewer to bring, cary, & cauſe to be broughte and caried their ale to the houſeholdes of our ſoueraygne lord the kyng, the Quene, the princes, and to euery archbyſhops, byſhoppes, dukes, markeſſes, Earles, barons, or other honorable mennes houſes in tonnes buttes, pypes, hoggeſhedes, or other veſſels of greater or larger quantitie than is expreſſed in this preſente acte, as before time hath ben vſed in that behalfe. And alſo it ſhall be lawfull to the ſaid ale brewers to bring cary, or cauſe to be brought conueyde or caried theyr ale to euery mans houſe in barrels, kylderkyns, & fyrkyns bearyng and holdynge theyr true contentes, accordyng to the purport and effect of this preſent act, any thyng conteyned in the ſame acte to the contrary hereof notwithſtandyng.
